data.title: Ep143: The Burbs by It Came From The Videostore
data.meta_description: We decided to do a classic that Brandon has never seen, The Burbs! Starring Tom Hanks, Carrie Fisher, Corey Feldman and many many more. Ray Peterson begins to think there is something weird about the new next door neighbors. There's a lot of laughs and macabre in this 1989 horror comedy! Check out the episode and let us know what you think!
data.text:
With Deadpool&Wolverine we decided to talk about the first time they shared the big screen! the Infamous X-Men Origins: Wolverine. A prequel to the X-Men franchise based on our favorite canadian mutant, wolverine! This movie has been on our list for years cause well.... frankly its bad. So check out the review and tell us what you think!

We decided to do a classic that Brandon has never seen, The Burbs! Starring Tom Hanks, Carrie Fisher, Corey Feldman and many many more. Ray Peterson begins to think there is something weird about the new next door neighbors. There's a lot of laughs and macabre in this 1989 horror comedy! Check out the episode and let us know what you think!

We took a small break (life has been busy for us). But we are back with a fun one! Event Horizon. A sci-fi horror from 1997 starring Sam Neil and Laurence Fishburne. Its a mix of several horror movies except this one takes place...in SPACE! Check out the episode and tell us what you think!

This week we talk about a childhood cult classic full of jokes and horrors, for kids this time. Little Monsters starring Fred Savage and Howie Mandel. Young Brian discovers the monster underworld with his new monster buddy, Maurice. Only issue is some monsters have their own agenda! This is a throwback for us as we grew up with this classic! Check out the episode and let us know what you think in a rating and review wherever possible! thanks for listening

The Mummy is turning 25 years old so we decided to do an episode on this classic starring Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. Rick O'Connell and Evie need to stop the evil Imhotep from wreaking havoc in his mission to reincarniate his lost love. Check out the episode and let us know what you think in a rating or review where ever you can leave one!

This episode is a little...weird. We talk about the cult classic "UHF" starring the one and only Weird Al Yankovic. George Newman inherits a UHF tv station and has to compete against a local cable tycoon. Its full of jokes and gags, and many quotable lines!Check out the episode and tell us what you think by leaving a rating and review wherever possible!

Smoookin! Can't make the scene if you don't have got the green!! So this March's episode is "The Mask" starring Jim Carrey and is loosely based on the comicbook of the same name. Some call this one of Jim Carrey's best films. Check out the episode and tell us what you think! Leave a rating and or review wherever possible! enjoy!

That's not my Robocop!! This episode we look at 1990's Robocop 3. A movie that destroyed a franchise in some peoples eyes and does not include Peter Weller as the titular hero! Robocop takes on OCP in this final installment. Check it out and tell us what you think! Leave a rating and review wherever possible!

Its been a minute since we last talked about Robocop. We finally got back around to the franchise to review "Robocop 2"

Peter Weller returns as the half robot, half cop named Murphy to continue his fight on crime in detroit!

Do you enjoy the Robocop franchise? Check out the episode and tell us what you think by leaving us a rating and review wherever possible or by following us on facebook and IG!

Back from hiatus to review 1990's "Puppet Master 2"

The Puppets return to hunt down paranormal researchers for their master Toulon!

Check it out and tell us what you think!

Follow us on facebook and IG at "It Came From the Videostore"

and please leave a rating and review wherever possible!

Following the success of Batman 89' Director Tim Burton teams up once again with Michael Keaton for Batman Returns in 1992! Also Starring Michelle Pfieffer,Danny Devito and Christopher Walken.A sequel some felt was "Too Dark" which lead to following sequels to take a lighter tone route! Check out the episode and tell us what you think!

We recorded this months ago, but life got in the way so we had to hold off til now. We watched a nostalgic gem from 1999 ... "Mystery Men" with an all star cast featuring Ben Stiller, Hank Azaria, Geoffrey Rush,Janeane Garofalo, William H.Macy and many,many more! Together they star as a band of misfit "heroes" out to take down the evil "Casanova Frankenstein." Have you seen this movie? Do you like it? Tell us what you think on social media (facebook,instagram or X) and leave a rating or review wherever possible!

For this list episode, we decided to talk about movies that terrified us as children. Movies that were meant for kids...that went that extra mile to mess us up! What movies scared you as a kid? Let us know on social media (Facebook,Instragram and X) and be sure to leave a rating or review wherever possible!

This week we review "The New Mutants." An X-Men spin off that is hard to say what year it really was made due to several reshoots and pushbacks due to the pandemic. The film does indeed give us new mutants, set in an asylum with a horror vibe attempting at the first of its kind in the franchise. Check out the episode and tell us what you think! Find us anywhere on social media and leave a review wherever possible!

This week we review the requel to 2009's G.I. Joe Rise of Cobra. We call it a "requel" cause its known as a reboot and a very loose sequel to the first film. New direction, new style and an all knew cast starring such like Dwayne Johnson and Bruce Willis along with others! Check out the episode and tell us what you think on social media and wherever you can leave reviews!

There's more than meets the eye....(errr ear?)with this episode! we finally decided to start the never ending Transformers franchise that started in 2007 and blew up the careers of Shia Lebouf and Megan Fox! We review the Michael Bay action packed film about the war between the Autobots and the Decepticons and their fight for thr all-spark cube! Check out our review and tell us what you think! leave a review or rating wherever possible! and thanks for listening!

It's Morbin' time! Morbius came out 2022 after several delays and reshoots! Starring Jared Leto as the title Character Michael Morbius. A doctor trying to cure his rare blood disease turns himself into a blood thirsty monster! Typically a spider-man villian...Morbius is another crack at a villain spin-off film. Check out what we thought of the film! Did you like Morbius? Let us know on facebook or instagram and leave a rating and review wherever possible!

Psychics arrived to a hotel to attend the funeral of a colleague and find themselves hunted down by murderous animated puppets!! Puppet Master is known as a cult classic and has been requested by many for us to review so we finally watched it! Check out the episode to see what we think!and Let us know what you think and leave a review wherever possible! and as always, thanks for listening!

Hugh Jackman stars as the famed victorian monster hunter Van Helsing, as he tries to take down Count Dracula from a completing a monstrous plan! its full of other classic monsters and early 2000's horror action cheese! but does it hold up? Check out the episode to see what we think! and tell us what you think on facebook and instagram!!

Continuing the Celebration of the 30th Anniversary of The Mighty Morphin Power Rangers with the follow up to the 95' movie, Turbo:A Power Rangers Movie.

With a new Ranger roster including the youngest ranger Justin, the team faces off against the Evil Devatox. This sequel is loved by some, disliked by others. Listen as we discuss the second original Power Rangers movie!

Taking it back to the 90's and celebrating Power Rangers 30th anniversary by reviewing the MMPR movie 1995! Starring the cast from the then 95' TV series along with some fresh faces and a morphinominal soundtrack!The Rangers take on the villianious Ivan Oooze as he tries to take over Angel Grove! So Sit back as we discuss this nostalgic golden nugget!

Its an Attack of the remake episode! Where we compare a remake to the original! This time we compare the original Wolfman from 1946 to the 2010 remake! A remake that leaves some horror fans divided! Check out our review and tell us what you think wherever you can leave a review!

Green Lantern! Starring Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively, Mark Strong and many more! A movie known for being so bad, even Ryan Reynolds himself roasts it whenever he gets the chance! Reynolds plays Hal Jordon, who is chosen to be an intergalactic guardian known as Green Lantern and is to help the rest of the Lantern Corp defeat the evil Parallax! This movie was meant to start off a version of the Justice League but sadly didn't make it off the ground. Check out the episode for our Review of.. The Green Lantern!

In 1991 The Rocketeer was released starring Billy Campbell,Jennifer Connelly, Alan Arkin and Timothy Dalton. When a young Pilot stumbles across a jetpack, he must keep it from getting into the wrong hands in this 1940s era based adventure movie! listen and find out what we think! Please subscribe,rate and review wherever possible!

We all love a good Final Girl! For those who don't know, a final girl is the survivor of a horror film! In this episode we discuss our favorite final girls, and some who we believe to be the worst. Please enjoy and tell us your favorite final girl on twitter, instagram or wherever you can leave a review!

This week we discuss a video game movie adaptation not many remember, 1994 Double Dragon!! Jimmy and Billy have to stop gang leader/crime lord Koga Shuko from taking over L.A. with an ancient Chinese Talisman known as "the Double Dragon." Full of 90's action and plenty of that nostalgic cheesiness we all love! Check it out! Please subscribe,rate,and review wherever possible!

Godzilla 1998 was one of our first episodes we ever did! But we were learning and didnt figure out the audio or our flow well, plus Matt wasn't around for the recording so we decided to do a Rewind Episode and re-review the movie! Godzilla 1998 stars Matthew Broderick, Jean-Reno and more! Some love it, some hate it. Listen out to see how we feel...again!

Continuing our Vincent Price marathon with 1974's Madhouse. Price plays actor Paul Toombes who is starting to wonder if he's responsible for a string of murders following his return to acting after several years! This film also stars horror legend Peter Cushing. Tell us what you think of the episode in a rating and review where ever possible!

We decided do a Vincent Price Spotlight but with our busy schedules we decided to stretch it out and make it multiple episodes so we started with Dr.Phibes Rises Again. Check out episode 68 The Abominable Dr.Phibes if you haven't yet! In this film Price returns as Phibes who is now determined to resurrect his beloved wife Victoria and kills anyone who gets in his way! Check out the episode and let us know what you think!

This episode we take a stab at the 8th installment of the Friday the 13th franchise! Jason Takes Manhattan! A movie that should just be retitled "Jason Takes a Cruise." A movie with so many continuity errors to make your head explode! We hope you listen and tell us what you think in a rating and review wherever possible!

In 1993 Roger Corman began production on The Fantastic Four after gaining the rights from marvel. With a incredibly low budget of one million dollars. The film was made, never to be released until a bootleg VHS was leaked. We found it online and just WOW. Check out the episode and tell us what you think!

In 1989 Robert Englund starred in a gore filled remake of The Phantom of the Opera. It has blood, time travel, and super powers. We wish we were kidding on this one. Take a listen and tell us what you think!

A straight to video sequel of the 1990 cult classic Darkman. This time around is stars Arnold Vosloo (The Mummy) filing in for the role of Peyton Weslake. Crime boss Robert Durant played by Larry Drake seems to survive the events of the first film and Darkman is out to finish the job! Listen and tell us what you think!!

Back in 1990 Sam Raimi (Director of Evil Dead and Spiderman) created the super hero "Darkman." Starring Liam Neeson as Peyton Weslake AKA Darkman. It was a revenge film mixed with both Batman and Phantom of the Opera vibes. With classic Raimi trademarks. Take a listen and tell us what you think!

With an all-star cast including Val Kilmer, Jim Carrey and Tommy Lee Jones, Batman Forever seemed destined for greatness. Sadly its received mixed reviews since its release in 1995. We take a stroll down memory lane in this episode and talk about this take on the Dark Knight. We hope you enjoy!
